Description: Rim and neck sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; interior glazed black with band in added red below rim; exterior: glazed black on moulded rim; below, black-figure siren to right (head with added white face and red fillet in hair and red wing with white band and dots remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see British Museum 1952,0505.5 from Tell Dafana. R. M. Cook's Petrie Group or related; cf. Cook (1952) 128ff. Similar pieces from Naukratis: CVA Cambridge 2 pl. XIX.7-11; CVA Oxford 2 pl. x.16-20. [Hayes 1992 p.208 no. N26]
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 208, no. N26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.107) (phase 3)
